intro: Gynochthodes oresbia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
